bonsais.name: Ficus Ginseng Kokedama
bonsais.description: One of the most beautiful and elegant plants. Its trunk and its particular aerial roots make it a perfect match for the kokedama.
bonsais.cares: Bright room, indirect sunlight, avoid direct air sources, low water requirement.

bonsais.name: Juniperus
bonsais.description: This bonsai species is very suitable for deadwood designs and looks great with whatever you like.
bonsais.cares: Outdoors, brightly lit site, organic fertiliser; make sure to pinch out long shoots to develop leafy clouds.

bonsais.name: Carmona Microphylla
bonsais.description: Bonsai Carmona is also known as 'scorpion tree' because of the way its branches grow, resembling the shape of a scorpion.
bonsais.cares: Indoors, low temperatures, natural lighting, abundant watering.

bonsais.name: Kotate Mochi
bonsais.description: Size between 15 and 30 cm. Lush forest style, reminiscent of the cool tree in Avatar.
bonsais.cares: Definitely needs a lot of water in order to keep alive that nice moss that covers its roots.

bonsais.name: Empire Ficus
bonsais.description: Easy to maintain. His little leafy style make it looks like it would rather be dead.
bonsais.cares: Do not let his emaciated appearance fool you: his resistance to adversity is truly impressive.

bonsais.name: Maple
bonsais.description: Its amazing shades of red, orange and yellow make it a perfect choice for anyone who would like to experience fall vibes all year.
bonsais.cares: Does not necessarily need a lot of attention and care, but you will give it to it anyway.
